title: Validation of MOOC Web Content Quality Models and Application to Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Learning Design Theories and Foundational Knowledge of MOOC Platforms
context.additional_context: A professional development course aimed at building competencies in MOOC content development and quality evaluation for mathematics.

learning_goals: A MOOC content quality evaluation framework is applied using the 7C model (Communication, Curriculum, Context, Choice, Collaboration, Constructivism, Co-evaluation) and the PDCA cycle based on learning design.
From the content providerâ€™s perspective, internal quality elements (9 categories, 54 sub-elements) of MOOC web content are analyzed and evaluated according to validity verification procedures.
Expert surveys are designed using a dichotomous Rasch model-based content validity verification method, and data-driven quality improvement directions are proposed.

resources: MOOC Platform Development Tools (e.g., Moodle, edX)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
